Articles.Content:
KSP is a bit rough around the edges in some places I don't think anyone would dispute that. So I was woundering if it would be worth it for Squad to do an update soon that is primarily focused on polishing what has already been implemented, example the MK 3 cockpit. I know that normally this is something that you do at the end of a project but I don't think it would do any harm. Sprig cleaning if you will. It could be the update where little things are added, better editor tools for example.

I don't really know if it would be worth it at this point in development so I want your opinion. If enough good ideas get thrown around I might start up a list, let me know if this is a good idea or not.

It'll be a waste of time, because once they add new features, they can go right back to polishing again. And again. And again.

There's a pritty good reason that polishing is only done at the end

I'm sorry but I mostly agree with brave Sirrobert. As bad as the stock parts are there are so many great mods that I can't really complain. I would prefer Squad to continue working on new mechanics. They refine some things from update to update anyway.

It's like on a building site: if you put in the windows/wash the floors before you've finished putting the bricks down, the windows will get broken/the floors will get dirty and you'll start all over again...
A quick pass over the Squad directory assets ensuring their textures are correctly PoT, appropriate size/resolution for their parts and finally sans alpha channel if appropriate would nice
